headline: US stock futures dip as crypto takes another beating and oil prices surge
summary: Wall Street was poised to give back some of last week's gains when markets open Monday, while oil prices surged and anything related to cryptocurrency sank as investors appeared to distance themselves from risk.  Nasdaq futures slipped 1%.  The original crypto currency, which bolted to record highs near $125,000 in early October, has lost nearly a third of its value since.

headline: Strategy Buys Just 130 More Bitcoin. Why Else the Stock Is Tumbling.
summary: After going a week without buying Bitcoin,  Strategy  made another purchase.  In a securities filing Monday, the world‚Äôs largest corporate holder of  Bitcoin  disclosed that it had bought just 130 tokens in the nearly two-week period from Nov. 17 to Nov. 30.  The $11.7 million purchase brought Strategy‚Äôs total holdings to 650,000 Bitcoins, acquired for roughly $48.38 million in total.

content.title: Strategy Buys Just 130 More Bitcoin. Why Else the Stock Is Tumbling.

The $11.7 million purchase brought Strategy‚Äôs total holdings to 650,000 Bitcoins, acquired for roughly $48.38 million in total.

headline: Bitcoin dips below $85,000 in cryptocurrency rout
summary: Bitcoin and companies tied to cryptocurrencies extended a nearly two-month swoon Monday, tracking with a broader market sell-off in technology companies that many see as overvalued.  Bitcoin, which soared to a record $126,210.50 on Oct. 6 according to crypto trading platform Coinbase, slid 11.8% to below $85,000.  Stocks across the crypto industry tumbled, with Coinbase Global sinking 5.1% and online trading platform Robinhood Markets losing 5.2%.

content.title: Bitcoin dips below $85,000 in cryptocurrency rout
content.summary: Bitcoin and companies tied to cryptocurrencies extended a nearly two-month swoon Monday, tracking with a broader market sell-off in technology companies that many see as overvalued.  Bitcoin, which soared to a record $126,210.50 on Oct. 6 according to crypto trading platform Coinbase, slid 11.8% to below $85,000.  Stocks across the crypto industry tumbled, with Coinbase Global sinking 5.1% and online trading platform Robinhood Markets losing 5.2%.

headline: From Cash App to Coinbase: Cat Ferdon on Marketing the Crypto Frontier
summary: Joining Gen C, Coinbase CMO, Cat Ferdon shares the strategy behind marketing one of the world's most powerful crypto brands. Cat discusses why economic freedom is Coinbase's core mission, how the company is moving beyond the "crypto native" audience to onboard the next generation, and her plan to normalize "internet money" by delivering culturally resonant campaigns that define the next decade of global adoption.

content.title: From Cash App to Coinbase: Cat Ferdon on Marketing the Crypto Frontier
content.description: Joining Gen C, Coinbase CMO, Cat Ferdon shares the strategy behind marketing one of the world's most powerful crypto brands. Cat discusses why economic freedom is Coinbase's core mission, how the company is moving beyond the "crypto native" audience to onboard the next generation, and her plan to normalize "internet money" by delivering culturally resonant campaigns that define the next decade of global adoption.
content.summary: Joining Gen C, Coinbase CMO, Cat Ferdon shares the strategy behind marketing one of the world's most powerful crypto brands. Cat discusses why economic freedom is Coinbase's core mission, how the company is moving beyond the "crypto native" audience to onboard the next generation, and her plan to normalize "internet money" by delivering culturally resonant campaigns that define the next decade of global adoption.

headline: Bitcoin dips tumbles below $85,000 in crypto rout
summary: Bitcoin and companies tied to cryptocurrencies extended a nearly two-month swoon Monday, tracking with a broader market sell-off in technology companies that many see as overvalued.  Bitcoin slid 6.5% after being down nearly 12% earlier in the day, settling in just above $85,000.  The most-traded cryptocurrency is down about 33% since hitting a record $126,210.50 on Oct. 6, according to crypto trading platform Coinbase.

headline: What bitcoin's extended sell-off means for crypto stocks
summary: Bitcoin (BTC-USD) volatile streak continues into December as the crypto asset fluttered above and below $85,000 per token multiple times on Monday. The downward price action since bitcoin's record high from early October has arrested the cryptocurrency's gains for 2025. Yahoo Finance senior markets reporter Ines Ferr√© comes on Market Domination to talk more about Wall Street sentiments on the crypto sector and the impact that the broader sell-off has had on crypto-exposed stocks like Coinbase Global (COIN), Strategy (MSTR), and Circle Internet Group (CRCL). To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

content.description:
Bitcoin (BTC-USD) volatile streak continues into December as the crypto asset fluttered above and below $85,000 per token multiple times on Monday. The downward price action since bitcoin's record high from early October has arrested the cryptocurrency's gains for 2025.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more¬†Market Domination.

headline: Bitcoin Rout Picks Up Steam as Investors Fret Over a New ‚ÄòCrypto Winter‚Äô
summary: The world‚Äôs largest digital currency traded at $85,468 as of 4 p.m. Eastern time in New York and is down more than 30% from a peak above $126,000 set in early October.  The selloff has spilled into other digital coins, including ether and solana, and pulled down stocks tied to the crypto market such as exchange operator  Coinbase Global  and  Strategy  Michael Saylor‚Äôs  bitcoin-accumulation company.  Bitcoin and other digital tokens have been caught up in a broader decline afflicting riskier trades across all markets.

content.title: Bitcoin Rout Picks Up Steam as Investors Fret Over a New ‚ÄòCrypto Winter‚Äô
content.summary: The world‚Äôs largest digital currency traded at $85,468 as of 4 p.m. Eastern time in New York and is down more than 30% from a peak above $126,000 set in early October.  The selloff has spilled into other digital coins, including ether and solana, and pulled down stocks tied to the crypto market such as exchange operator  Coinbase Global  and  Strategy  Michael Saylor‚Äôs  bitcoin-accumulation company.  Bitcoin and other digital tokens have been caught up in a broader decline afflicting riskier trades across all markets.

headline: Coinbase Government Requests Surge 19% as Global Surveillance Expands
summary: Coinbase has seen an increase of 19% year-over-year for government and law-enforcement information requests, reaching 12,716 from October 2024 to September 2025. The US leads in single-made requests by country, but more than half of the requests came from other countries, with Germany leading. Data is from Coinbase‚Äôs Transparency Report ...

headline: Bitnomial to Launch First CFTC-Regulated Spot Crypto Market in US
summary: Chicago-based fintech firm Bitnomial could soon become the first Designated Contract Market (DCM)-licensed cryptocurrency exchange to offer spot crypto trading in the US. The company submitted a self-certification declaration and filing to the Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) under regulation 40.6(a), a law that allows DCMs to offer spot products ...

Bitcoin slid 5.6% after being down nearly 12% earlier in the day, settling in just above $86,000.  The most-traded cryptocurrency is down about 33% since hitting a record $126,210.50 on Oct. 6, according to crypto trading platform Coinbase.

thumbnail.caption: FILE - Bitcoin tokens are seen on April 3, 2013, in Sandy, Utah. (AP Photo/Rick Bowmer, File)

headline: Stock market today: Dow, S&P 500, Nasdaq futures stakk after stocks, bitcoin get hit to begin December
summary: Stock futures rose after a day of strong declines as crypto markets collapsed and tech continued to grapple with valuation concerns.
